Q.6 Fish belonging to species S in the deep sea have skins that are extremely black (ultra-black skin). This helps them not only to avoid predators but also sneakily attack their prey. However, having this extra layer of black pigment results in lower collagen on their skin, making their skin more fragile. options.A: Having ultra-black skin is only advantageous to species S
options.B: Species S with lower collagen in their skin are at an advantage because it helps them avoid predators
options.C: Having ultra-black skin has both advantages and disadvantages to species S
options.D: Having ultra-black skin is only disadvantageous to species S but advantageous only to their predators
